availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: Silas Babbit (Oldham County, Kentucky, manufacturer, mill wright, and stone mason)

body.p: Oldham County, Kentucky, manufacturer, mill wright, and stone mason. Virginia native. Married to Rebecca Shaw Babbit in Oldham County, Kentucky, on November 24, 1825. Father of Mary Babbit. Married to Rebecca Ross Babbit in Oldham County on December 3, 1835. Father of Rachel Babbit, George Babbit, Catherine Babbit, Stephen Babbit, John Babbit, Lucy Babbit, and James Babbit. Married to Rebecca Babbit. Resident of Oldham County in 1830. Engaged in manufacturing and trade in Oldham County in 1840. Owned three enslaved persons in Oldham County in 1840. Mill wright in Oldham County in 1850. Stone mason in Oldham County in 1860.
